newsitem.title: USA: Gasoline pump prices creep up, AAA says.
newsitem.headline: Gasoline pump prices creep up, AAA says.

text.p: Gasoline pump prices edged up in September, halting a three-month slide, according to the American Automile Association (AAA).

In its Sept. 17 Fuel Gauge report, AAA said self-serve regular unleaded gasoline rose to an average $1.255 per gallon this month, up 0.2 cent from August. But the price was still 8.7 cents above year-ago levels.

Pump prices were highest in the West, where a gallon of gasoline averaged $1.387, 12 cents above last year. In the Northeast, gasoline prices rose 1.7 cents from August to $1.273 per gallon, AAA said.
